meanings.definition: The process of sorting or prioritizing patients based on the severity of their condition.
meanings.sent1: During a disaster, triages help medical staff decide who to treat first.
meanings.sent2: The hospital's triages efficiently managed the influx of patients after the accident.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the characters created a game using triages to decide the order of their tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a set of triages, organizing thoughts based on importance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful stickers to represent different levels of triages for the students to understand better.

meanings.definition: To assign degrees of urgency to medical cases in order to determine the order of treatment.
meanings.sent1: The doctor triages the patients quickly to ensure those in critical condition receive immediate care.
meanings.sent2: She always triages the tasks on her to-do list to focus on the most important ones first.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to triages its toys, always playing with the same one first.
meanings.sent4: His ability to triages problems efficiently made him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The leader triages the issues facing the community, addressing the most pressing ones first.

meanings.definition: A system for determining the order of treatment based on the severity of a patient's condition.
meanings.sent1: The hospital implemented new triages to streamline patient care.
meanings.sent2: The triages in place helped the medical team prioritize their tasks effectively.
meanings.sent3: The triages in the cafeteria menu made it easy for students to choose their meals.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was like a set of triages, with color-coded tabs for different subjects.
meanings.sent5: The triages in the emergency room saved lives by ensuring prompt treatment for critical cases.
